# The furnace now contains:
# - 5 iron ore
# - 2 iron plates (indicating that some smelting has already occurred)

# My inventory has been updated to:
# - 5 coal
# - 4 iron plates
# - 1 iron gear wheel

# It seems that the furnace is actively smelting the iron ore into iron plates. 
# I need to wait for the smelting process to complete before I can proceed with crafting any items that require iron plates.

# I will monitor the furnace for the completion of the smelting process. 
# I will wait for a maximum of 30 seconds to check how many iron plates have been produced.

for _ in range(30):  # Maximum wait time of 30 seconds
    if inspect_inventory(new_furnace)[Prototype.IronPlate] >= 10:  # Check if I have at least 10 iron plates
        break
    sleep(1)
else:
    raise Exception("Smelting timeout - check fuel and inputs")  # Raise an error if smelting takes too long

# After waiting, I will check the furnace inventory again to see how many iron plates have been produced. 
print(f"Final Furnace status: {inspect_inventory(new_furnace)}")  # Check the final contents of the furnace after waiting.
